info.headline: Avalanche Warning issued December 31 at 8:57AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: THE FOLLOWING MESSAGE IS TRANSMITTED AT THE REQUEST OF THE TAOS AVALANCHE CENTER. THE TAOS AVALANCHE CENTER IN TAOS HAS ISSUED A BACKCOUNTRY AVALANCHE WARNING. * WHAT...THE AVALANCHE DANGER WILL RISE TO HIGH TODAY INTO NEW YEARS DAY. * WHERE...WHEELER PEAK WILDERNESS AREA AND COLUMBINE HONDO WILDERNESS ABOVE 9000 FEET. * WHEN... IN EFFECT FROM 700 AM MST TODAY TO 800 AM MST SUNDAY. * IMPACTS...SNOW AND WIND TODAY THROUGH NEW YEARS DAY WILL CONTINUE TO ADD TO SNOW TOTALS ACCUMULATED OVER THE LAST WEEK, APPROACHING 5 TO 6 FEET OF SNOW. THIS WILL LIKELY CREATE WIDESPREAD AREAS OF UNSTABLE SNOW. BOTH HUMAN TRIGGERED AND NATURAL AVALANCHES ARE LIKELY. STAY OFF SLOPES STEEPER THAN 30 DEGREES. THIS WARNING DOES NOT APPLY TO SKI AREAS WHERE AVALANCHE HAZARD REDUCTION MEASURES ARE PERFORMED. SIMILAR AVALANCHE DANGER MAY EXIST AT LOCATIONS OUTSIDE THE COVERAGE AREA OF THIS OR ANY AVALANCHE CENTER. * PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...VERY DANGEROUS AVALANCHE CONDITIONS EXIST. TRAVEL IN AND AROUND AVALANCHE TERRAIN IS NOT RECOMMENDED. SIMILAR AVALANCHE DANGER MAY EXIST AT LOCATIONS OUTSIDE THE COVERAGE AREA OF THIS OR ANY AVALANCHE CENTER. CONSULT HTTP://WWW.TAOSAVALANCHECENTER.ORG OR WWW.AVALANCHE.ORG FOR MORE DETAILED INFORMATION.
